content.description: Start at the right end of the wall. Follow the obvious hand crack system up for 50 or 60 ft , then the gear and crack run out. Time to do a super cool step around move( climb lightly on the chicken heads)into another crack system to the top.
content.protection: Standard Trad rack,nuts useful. A couple of runners for drag reduction. Gear not straightforeward in some spots, but is definately there.

climbs.name: The Right Stuff
climbs.fa: Todd Battey and Dave Stahl, June 1988

content.description: From the base climb a short easy corner to a large ledge.  A tricky initial lieback move lead to another small ledge. From there splitter hands jams continue to just below the lip, where interesting thin hands finish the route.
content.protection: A few small pieces, with mostly hand size.  Two bolt anchor ( 1/4" with faded webbing ) for the belay.

content.description: Start near the right end of the wall. Go up and left  in the gully to a short fist crack start 15ft, then the crack thins to nice fingers with the occasional locker hand, some fun moves here. You will move up and left changing crack systems until the crack peeters out, then hang a hard left and traverse over 15 or 20 feet(good gear) to a nice varnished crack seam to the summit (place gear before the crack seam ,no pro in seam)you can protect the exit moves.
content.protection: This route takes the gear. Bring a standard trad rack with cams up to #3 camalot. Heavy on finger size pieces. The route wanders and is kinda long so bring runners. Trad anchor. 3rd class off left
content.location: Katchina walls are on the right side of the  valley you enter after passing frontier wall. Its about a 10 min walk from frontier wall. Katchina walls are obvious after about 5 mins of hiking.
